items.item: Catechist
Youth Ministry Volunteer
Youth Ministry Coordinator
DRE/CRE
Special Minister of Holy Communion
Lector
Musician
I’m not volunteering and just want to learn more

knowledge.header: Please tell us about your knowledge of Sacred Scriptures.

items.item: I know what the Scriptures are but I have only heard the terms “Inspiration” and “Revelation.
I have a general understanding of Catholic Scripture, Inspiration, and Revelation but would have a hard time explaining this material to someone else.
I am confident in my ability to teach the Catholic understanding of Scripture, Inspiration, and Revelation to others.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Speaking of Scripture, please tell us about your understanding with the Old Testament.

items.item: My exposure to the OT is watching “The Ten Commandments” and listening to the first reading at Mass.
When I hear the first reading on Sunday, I know where to find that book in the OT and have a general understanding of its subject matter.
Given the opportunity, I could identify specific themes and figures from the OT and speak of the influence each has on our salvation history.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Now tell us about your knowledge of the New Testament.

items.item: Everything I learned about the New Testament comes from Sunday Mass and thereligion classes I have taken.
I understand my own role as a disciple of Christ and an evangelist in today’s world and can point to specific texts in the NT that inspire me.
I understand my own role as a disciple of Christ and an evangelist in today’s world and can point to specific texts in the NT that inspire me.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Moving on to the Creed, please choose the phrase that best describes your understanding and experience of the Trinity

items.item: Three in One
Tripersonal God
Perichoresis
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Please tell us about your knowledge and experience of the Church’s theology and mission.

items.item: I know that the Church is more than the building where I attend Mass but could not explain its structure or relationships.
I know that the Church is more than the building where I attend Mass but could not explain its structure or relationships.
I know that the  Church is one, holy, catholic, and apostolic and am confident in my ability to explain what this means.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Now tell us about your understanding of the meaning and practices of the Sacraments.

items.item: I have heard that worship is integral to our lives as Christians but I could not communicate much to others about the Liturgical Year or the connection of the Creed to the Sacramental life of the Church.
I understand how our faith is celebrated differently at different times of the year and can communicate that to others.
I understand how our faith is celebrated differently at different times of the year and can communicate that to others.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Getting more specific, tell us about your knowledge of the Seven Sacraments.

items.item: I can name the seven Sacraments and have received some of them, but that’s the extent of my experience and understanding.
I know how the seven Sacraments are categorized and would like to learn more about each of them.
I know how to explain the seven Sacraments and I actively participate in the sacramental life of the church and doing so allows me to love in a different way.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Foundations and principles of morality are kind of a big deal in the Catholic Church. Tell us about how your understanding of our moral tradition influences your daily life.

items.item: My moral decision making process is rooted in where I want to spend eternity.
My personal relationship with Jesus has an impact on how I make moral decisions.
I am able to articulate the principles on which I rely when making moral decisions.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Our moral teachings are rooted in Scripture. They include the Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes, among other things. Tell us what you know.

items.item: I can recite the Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes.
I can explain the Ten Commandments and the implications of the Beatitudes on my daily life.
I am confident in my ability to explain the relationship between the Beatitudes and the Ten Commandments in light of contemporary controversial topics.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Catholic Social Teaching has been called the best kept secret in the Catholic Church. How much do you know about this secret?

items.item: I have heard of Catholic Social Teaching and know that our faith challenges me to build a just society for all.
Solidarity, subsidiarity, and preferential option for the poor are all words with which I am familiar and use in my conversations about justice.
I know and can explain the seven principles of Catholic Social Teaching.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: The study of church history tells us how major events in the last 2000 years have shaped our community of faith. Tell us what you know about church history.

items.item: The last time I studied church history was in elementary or high school.
I have a general knowledge of church history, Christological heresies, and church structure and could answer basic questions from my friends and family.
I can demonstrate how our faith has developed over time and how the church in the modern world has responded to changing needs.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Prayer is how we connect on a daily basis with God. Tell us about your own prayer experience.

items.item: My prayer experience and methodology has not really changed since childhood.
I am familiar with the types of prayer and how to pray with Scripture and would like to learn some specifics that would help me persevere in my own prayer.
I am practically a mystic when it comes to prayer and am interested in learning more about other schools of prayer.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: The prayer Jesus taught his followers is the Lord’s Prayer. Getting back to basics, riddle us this:

items.item: I can recite the Lord’s Prayer like a faithful Catholic but I seldom stop to think what it means or where it came from.
Praying the Lord’s Prayer has a meaningful impact on my daily life.
Praying the Lord’s Prayer is a way of seeing God, the world and myself in a way that is both profound and revolutionary.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Developing a person, intimate relationship with Jesus Christ is essential to a healthy Christian life. What do you think?

items.item: Having a personal relationship with Christ has always sounded so foreign to me. I’m not sure what it means.
I know what it means to have a personal relationship with Jesus and I want to learn about how I can strengthen that relationship.
I consider Jesus a close personal friend and that impacts every moment of my day.
None of these choices apply to me.

knowledge.header: Evangelization is everyone’s responsibility, even if you are not sure what it means. So tell us…

items.item: I have heard the term evangelization but never really thought about what it means or its impact on my life.
I know what it means to evangelize and am confident I understand its impact on my life.
My friends always come to me with questions about being Catholic because they know I have studies my faith and am willing to share my faith with others.
None of these choices apply to me.
